newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Brent steady, maintaining NYMEX arbitrage.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Brent steady, maintaining NYMEX arbitrage.

text.p: Brent crude futures were firmer in late afternoon dealings on Tuesday, cutting back into London's day-earlier losses as the market searched for direction.
April Brent was last traded at $20.34 per barrel, matching London's settlement. April fell 15 cents in small volume overnight in London.
Brokers said the market had little direction and was continuing to trade in a range of $20.00 to $20.85. Latest trading was in the middle of the range.
NYMEX April crude oil, trading on ACCESS, was last traded at $21.90 per barrel, down 13 cents from New York's close on Friday. New York markets were closed on Monday for a national holiday.
Brokers said Brent was trading in line with its Friday arbitrage with NYMEX of around $1.54 based on the April contracts.
